data: Towards the close of the last century there was a very remarkable man, Bishop of Down, in Ireland: a Liberal in politics, in an age when Liberalism lay close on the confines of disloyalty; splendidly hospitable, at a period when hospitality verged on utter recklessness; he carried all his opinions to extremes.
browsing: culture/civilization/society|browsing: literature|browsing: fiction|category: humour|category: novels|category: british literature
